oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Louise Mandrell
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Louise Mandrell (performer) for Nashville's WSM. Recording is from March 15, 1985.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Louise Mandrell
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Test tones and background noises can be heard -- (01:13) Louise Mandrell asks Ralph Emery how long the segment will take -- (01:40) Emery and Mandrell discuss the charity function they will both be participating in the next day and Mandrell's cooking abilities -- (06:02) Emery recalls a time he came over to Mandrell's for an event and her families cooking abilities -- (08:44) Emery addresses Mandrell's father's odd schedule effecting meals -- (10:44) Both Gilley and Mandrell joke about Mandrell's parties and a New Year's Eve party -- (12:41) Mandrell and Emery discuss Mandrell's sandwich -- (13:30) Mandrell addresses how her husband (R. C. Bannon) produced her new album -- (15:58) Mandrell and Emery discuss the ability to dance to the new album -- (17:13) "Devil in a Fast Car" and "I Wanna Say Yes" are discussed by Mandrell and Emery -- (18:17) The interview is interrupted and Emery and Mandrell talk to the new identity -- (19:35) Emery invites Mandrell to reflect on the new concepts reflected on in her album -- (23:27) Mandrell and Emery discuss Mandrell's passion for dancing -- (25:34) Mandrell discusses Bannon's significant productions -- (26:50) Mandrell and Emery discuss Barbara Mandrell and her medical issues -- (30:39) Emery invites Mandrell to discuss the fact that Mandrell is going to China -- (36:06) Emery asks about the international status of the Mandrell Sisters Television Show -- (37:45) Emery and Mandrell discuss her upcoming tour in China -- (38:36) Emery inquires about Mandrell's palette -- (41:00) Emery and Mandrell discuss Mandrell's commercial experience and Mandrell's recent haircut -- (43:50) Emery inquires about Mandrell's upcoming television schedule -- (45:42) Emery asks Mandrell if she has any thoughts of having children -- (47:40) The Louise Mandrell Country Trivia Game is described as the country music trivia -- (49:57) Mandrell describes her process of choosing which instrument to play on her shows -- (50:51) "Maybe My Baby" is joked about along with Mandrell's dress selection -- (51:53) Mandrell describes her album cover -- (52:43) Mandrell reflects on her image that people have given her
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Mandrell, Louise; Emery, Ralph;
